channel.title: HELP - nobody can access my server
channel.description:
Pleasee help! I don't know what's wrong!
I did port forward and everything, got a no-ip, but nobody can still access my server except me!
http://img208.imageshack.us/img208/3450/portforwardwc1.jpg <-- thats the picture of what my port forward thing looks like.
[br][size=1]Posted on: August 26, 2007, 12:57:49 PM[/size][hr]please help

item.title: HELP - nobody can access my server
item.dc:creator: @gunnz gunnz
item.description:
@gunnz wrote:

I know how I can access my server, but nobody else can access my server WITH MY ROUTER IP. That would be like them trying to access it from their router.[br][size=1]Posted on: August 31, 2007, 10:03:39 AM[/size][hr]ALSO, before I had a static ip, I had it working, but I don’t remember how to do it with a Dynamic IP. Is it possible?[br][size=1]Posted on: September 01, 2007, 10:31:42 AM[/size][hr]Still need help

Read full topic
item.source: HELP - nobody can access my server

item.title: HELP - nobody can access my server
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

If you try to access your server from another website using your router ip 192.168.2.* It will not work. You need to get a free subdomain from dyndns.com or use your router’s real ip. Which you can find out many ways.

Read full topic

item.title: HELP - nobody can access my server
item.dc:creator: @gunnz gunnz
item.description:
@gunnz wrote:

Okay, so with that and the port forwarding, it should work?

Edit: Ffs, it’s still not working,

I have the port forwarded, I have the port opened, but it still won’t work![br][size=1]Posted on: August 28, 2007, 12:59:42 PM[/size][hr]Am I supposed to do something else?[br][size=1]Posted on: August 29, 2007, 10:39:40 AM[/size][hr]I still need help guys :\

Read full topic
item.source: HELP - nobody can access my server

item.title: HELP - nobody can access my server
item.dc:creator: @bloop bloop
item.description:
@bloop wrote:

Opening 43594 (Default Port)

Open Network & Internet Connections. Right click on the connection you’re using to connect to the internet and click properties. Open the Advanced tab and click on firewall settings. Open the Exceptions tab and at the bottom you should see a button “Add Port”.
Click on it, and add your server name or whatever you want it to be at the Name field.
At the Port number fill in 43594.
And make sure the TCP box has been checked.

[br][size=1]Posted on: August 28, 2007, 12:51:34 PM[/size][hr]Dident want to use time to write it… so i copied from tut… ^^

Read full topic

What do you mean open? The only firewall I have is Windows Firewall xD
